Canadian Provinces and Cities Info

Use our Trip Advisor App To Plan Your Next Trip!

Make a selection to learn more about each province. We have chosen 3 great cities to visit in each province. Once you have decided your next destination, click next to see direct flights from your current location.

*By using this service, you agree to our terms and conditions.
*Allow browser access to location for best results.

Highest Bird Populations

  • Toronto, Ontario: Toronto is a vibrant city known for its cultural diversity and thriving arts scene. It offers a wide range of amenities including restaurants, shopping centers, and entertainment venues. There are over 50,000 hotel rooms available for visitors. Must-visit attractions include the CN Tower, Royal Ontario Museum, and Toronto Islands.
  • Vancouver, British Columbia: Vancouver is surrounded by stunning natural beauty, including mountains, forests, and beaches. It offers numerous amenities such as world-class restaurants, shopping districts, and outdoor recreational activities. Visitors can choose from over 30,000 hotel rooms. Popular attractions include Stanley Park, Granville Island, and Capilano Suspension Bridge.
  • Montreal, Quebec: Montreal is known for its rich history, European charm, and vibrant arts scene. It offers a diverse range of amenities including cafes, bistros, and boutique shops. There are over 25,000 hotel rooms available for visitors. Must-visit attractions include Old Montreal, Notre-Dame Basilica, and Mount Royal Park.

Cities with the Highest Elevation

  • Calgary, Alberta: Situated near the Rocky Mountains, Calgary is one of Canada's highest elevated cities. It is home to a diverse range of bird species, including eagles, hawks, and various migratory birds.
  • Banff, Alberta: Located within Banff National Park, Banff is surrounded by stunning mountainous landscapes. It attracts bird species such as golden eagles, peregrine falcons, and mountain bluebirds.
  • Canmore, Alberta: Nestled in the Bow Valley, Canmore offers breathtaking views of the Canadian Rockies. Birdwatchers can spot species like ospreys, owls, and woodpeckers in the surrounding wilderness.

Wildlife

  • Vancouver, British Columbia: Surrounded by lush forests and bordered by the Pacific Ocean, Vancouver is home to a diverse range of wildlife. Visitors can spot bears, cougars, bald eagles, and various marine mammals in their natural habitats.
  • Banff, Alberta: Located within Banff National Park, Banff offers abundant opportunities for wildlife viewing. Grizzly bears, elk, bighorn sheep, and mountain goats are commonly spotted in the park's stunning landscapes.
  • Churchill, Manitoba: Known as the "Polar Bear Capital of the World," Churchill attracts visitors from around the globe to witness polar bears in their natural habitat. Additionally, beluga whales, Arctic foxes, and numerous bird species can be observed in the area.
